Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, NY  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER CARRION.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, N.Y.  10013.

Council Member Povman moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 28, 2001 and April 17, 2001 be adopted and printed by Council Member Malave-Dilan.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Malave-Dilan moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 28, 2001 and April 17, 2001 be adopted and printed.

Items.Title: Messages and Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt & reserves which the City, the NYC Transitional Finance Authority, the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority, the NYS Dormitory Authority & the NYC Health & Hospitals Corporation may soundly incur for capital projects for Fiscal Year 2002 & the ensuing three fiscal years, & the maximum amount of appropriations & expenditures for capital projects which may soundly be made during each fiscal year, pursuant to Section 250 (16) of the NY City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Capital Projects for FY 2002 & the ensuring three fiscal years.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Estrellita Brodsky to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment to the New York City Art Commission, for the remainder of a three year term, expiring December 31, 2003, pursuant to Section 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Estrellita Brodsky, NYC Art Commission Appointment

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment
by the Borough President of Brooklyn of MARILYN G. GELBER As a member of the City Planning Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which referred on on April 25, 2001, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 31 and Section 192 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the appointment by the Borough President of Brooklyn, of MARILYN G. GELBER , as a member of the City Planning Commission for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 2002.

Res. No. 1910

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE BOROUGH PRESIDENT OF BROOKLYN OF MARILYN G. GELBER AS A MEMBER OF THE CITY PLANNING COMMISSION

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 31 and Section 192 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Borough President of Brooklyn of MARILYN G. GELBER as a member of the City Planning Commission for the remainder of a term which will expire on June 30, 2002.
Items.MatterName: M 1110 - City Planning Commission, Marilyn G. Gelber, Appointment

Items.MatterName: Sale of tax liens and tax lien foreclosure by action in rem.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the additional tax on the city personal income tax.
Items.MatterName: Additional tax on the city personal income tax.

Items.Title: Resolution pursuant to Section 19-511.1 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York to review fifteen determinations by the Taxi and Limousine Commission to approve applications for the renewal of a license to operate a base station.
Items.MatterName: Base Station License, Callup

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Schneiderman, S.2421-A, and Assembly Members Dinowitz, Klein, Greene, Kaufman, et al, A.1045-A, "AN ACT to dedicate the Jerome Park Reservoir tract in the Bronx as parkland".
Items.MatterName: Dedicate the Jerome Park Reservoir tract in the Bronx as parkland (S.2421-A, A.1045-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct an oversight hearing of the City's procurement practices related to the Manhattan Bridge renovation project.
Items.MatterName: Manhattan Bridge Renovation Project

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.3370, and Assembly Member Straniere, et al, A.4793, "AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the application of uniform land use review procedures".
Items.MatterName: Uniform land use review procedures (S.3370, A.4793)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Straniere, A.4977, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating the official flag of the borough of Staten Island".
Items.MatterName: Designating the official flag of the borough of Staten Island (A.4977)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Spano, S.4468, and Committee on Rules, A.8415, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the application of the age fifty-seven retirement program, the mandated physically taxing program and the incumbent fifty-five/twenty-five program for certain employees".
Items.MatterName: Age fifty-seven retirement program, the mandated physically taxing program annd the incumbent fifty-five/twenty-five program for certain employees (S.4468, A.8415)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Vitaliano, A.7409, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to accidental disability benefits for sanitation members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Accidental disability benefits for sanitation members (A.7409)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.2767, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5088, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law and the retirement and social security law, in relation to benefits for employees of governmental entities performing peace officer services in the city of New York, who are injured in the performance of their duties".
Items.MatterName: Benefits for employees of governmental entities performing peace officer services (S.2767, A.5088)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Fuschillo, S.4994, "AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, in relation to permitting police and fire personnel to accept other offices and to repeal section 1129 of such charter relating thereto".
Items.MatterName: Permitting police and fire personnel to accept other offices (S.4994)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.5096, and by Committee on Rules, A.8483, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a variable supplements fund for members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Establishing a variable supplements fund for members of the NYCERS (S.5096, A.8483)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4258-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8354-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees' retirement system or New York city board of education retirement system employed as special officers, parking control specialists, school agents, campus peace officers or New York city taxi and limousine inspectors; and to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for such members who are subject to articles 11 and 15 of such law ".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the NYCERS (S.4258-A, A.8354-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Straniere, A.7235, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring developers to post a bond to ensure compliance with any conditions of development".
Items.MatterName: Requiring developers to post a bond to ensure compliance with any conditions of development (A.7235)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Johnson, S.3254, and Assembly Member Sweeney, A.6496, "AN ACT in relation to reclassifying the retirement from the New York city police pension fund for ordinary disability of DeForest Taylor as a retirement for accident disability".
Items.MatterName: Reclassifying the retirement from the New York city police pension fund (S.3254, A.6496)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Marchi and Leibell, S.5097, and by Committee on Rules, A.8482, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year/age fifty retirement programs for senior automotive service workers, automotive service workers, auto body workers, auto mechanics, marine maintenance mechanics and oil burner specialists who are subject to articles 11 and 15 of such law; and in relation to providing for employer pick up, pursuant to provisions of the internal revenue code, of certain additional member contributions required to be made by certain participants in the twenty-five year/age fifty retirement programs".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year/age fifty retirement programs for senior automotive service workers, etc. (S.5097, A.8482)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Straniere, A.6536, "AN ACT to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to sales tax on clothing and footwear in cities with a population of one million or more".
Items.MatterName: Sales tax on clothing and footwear (A.6536)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Leibell, S.4772, and Committee on Rules, A.8487, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to retirement allowances payable to New York city police officers and firefighters".
Items.MatterName: Retirement allowances payable to New York city police officers and firefighters (S.4772, A.8487)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to banning campaign contributions by investment advisers who perform services in connection with the investment of city pension funds.
Items.MatterName: Banning campaign contributions by investment advisers connected with city pension funds.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the mandatory debate requirement for candidates participating in the campaign finance program for citywide elections.
Items.MatterName: Mandatory debate requirements for candidates participating in the campaign finance program.

Items.Title: Application no. 20015404 HAM, an Urban Development Action Area Project pursuant to the Third Party Transfer Program, located in Community Boards 7, 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12; Council Districts no. 4, 7, 8, 9 and 10; Borough of Manhattan.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development, and pursuant to Sections 696 of the General Municipal Law and 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law for exemptions from real property taxes.
Items.MatterName: UDAAP, CB 7-12 CD 4&7-10 Third Party Transfer Program, Manhattan (20015404HAM)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 010084 PPK, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter concerning the disposition of sixty-nine city-owned properties, located in Community Board 5, Borough of Brooklyn, in Council Districts no. 37 and 42.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 69 City-owned Properties CB#5, Brooklyn (C010084PPK)

Items.Title:
By Council Members Malave-Dilan and Wooten:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 010084 PPK, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 69 City-owned Properties CB#5, Brooklyn (C010084PPK)
